Package io.crums.sldg.packs

Class RowPackBuilder

java.lang.Object
io.crums.sldg.packs.RecurseHashRowPack
io.crums.sldg.packs.RowPackBuilder
All Implemented Interfaces:
io.crums.io.Serial, RowBag, io.crums.util.hash.Digest
public class RowPackBuilder
extends RecurseHashRowPack
implements io.crums.io.Serial
Builds a RowPack.

Rules of the Game

Every row bag must provably maintain rows from the same ledger. The following rules are designed to ensure this guarantee.

  1. An empty instance's rows may be initialized either with an existing row-pack or a ledger path. This initialization establishes the highest row number in the pack.
  2. A row may only ever be added if it is already referenced by an existing row in the bag.

Note rule (1) involves a degree of trust. Since the hash of the last row in the ledger represents the state of the entire ledger, extending a bag using a higher numbered path necessarily involves trusting the source of the information. We punt on how this done, for now.

Rule (1) is represenented by the init(Path) and init(RowPack) methods. Rule (2) is enforced by the add(Row) method.

See Also:
for the serialization format

    • addAll

      public int addAll​(RowPack pack) throws HashConflictException
      Adds all the rows in the given pack. If this instance is empty, then all the rows in the bag are added. Otherwise, only linked information is added. I.e. this method only allows adding detail to already known information.
      Returns:
      the number of full rows added
      Throws:
      HashConflictException - if a hash in bag conflicts with existing hashes.

    • init

      public int init​(RowPack pack)
      Initializes the instance with the given pack.
      Returns:
      the number of full rows added

      public int init​(Path path) throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
      Initializes the instance with the given path.
      Parameters:
      path - usually a state path
      Returns:
      the number of full rows added (i.e. path.rows().size()
      Throws:
      java.lang.IllegalStateException

    • addPath

      public int addPath​(Path path)
      Adds the rows in the given path that can be linked from the highest row in this instance.
      Parameters:
      path - a path whose lowest row number is ≤ hi()
      Returns:
      the number of rows added (possibly zero)

    • add

      public boolean add​(Row row) throws HashConflictException

      Adds the given row if it's not already in the bag, and if it's linked from an exisiting (higher numbered) row in the bag.

      With one exception this method is fail-fast. The single exception is on an assertion-panic, which may leave the instance in an inconsistent state.

      Parameters:
      row - with row-number ≤ hi()
      Returns:
      true iff the row was added
      Throws:
      HashConflictException - if the row's hash conflicts with existing hashes. If this happens, then the given row doesn't come from this bag's ledger.

    • size

      public int size()
      Returns the number of full rows in the bag.
      Returns:
      getFullRowNumbers().size()

    • isEmpty

      public boolean isEmpty()
      Determines whether the bag is empty.
      Returns:
      getFullRowNumbers().size() == 0

    • refOnlyHash

      protected java.nio.ByteBuffer refOnlyHash​(long rowNumber)
      Description copied from class: RecurseHashRowPack
      Returns the ref-only row-hash from the minimal store, if found. A minimal bag does not redundantly contain row-hashes for rows for which their input-hashes are known: the row-hash of such rows can computed from the hash of the concatenation of the input hash with the row-hashes from lower numbered rows.
      Specified by:
      refOnlyHash in class RecurseHashRowPack
      Returns:

    • rowHash

      public java.nio.ByteBuffer rowHash​(long rowNumber)

      Overriden only to synchronize.

      Returns the row-hash for the row at the given number. The eligible input arguments are both from the full row numbers and also the row numbers of rows they reference.
      Specified by:
      rowHash in interface RowBag
      Overrides:
      rowHash in class RecurseHashRowPack
      Parameters:
      rowNumber - a member of Ledger.coverage(getFullRowNumbers()) (note this includes row 0, where the sentinel hash must be returned)
      Returns:
      32-byte hash
